triples.name: Deepfake
triples.relevance: Deepfakes are the primary subject of study in this paper, representing synthetic videos that the research examines.

triples.name: Disinformation
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how deepfakes contribute to disinformation and explores the mechanisms through which this occurs.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI is the foundational technology that enables the creation of deepfakes discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Trust (social science)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a model explaining how deepfakes and uncertainty affect trust in news on social media.

triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: Social media is the platform where deepfakes spread and where trust in news is examined in this study.

triples.name: Visual communication
triples.relevance: The paper integrates theories about visual communication power to explain deepfake effects.

triples.name: Uncertainty
triples.relevance: The paper proposes uncertainty as a key mechanism through which deepfakes reduce trust in news.

triples.name: Experimental psychology
triples.relevance: The paper employs experimental methodology with novel treatments to investigate deepfake effects on people's evaluations.
